oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interior of a Southern Loose-Leaf Tobacco Warehouse
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An interior of a tobacco warehouse in Greenville, Tennessee, is shown with farmers and buyers from tobacco companies.

The sale of loose leaf tobacco by auction on the warehouse floor originated in Danville, Virginia, prior to the Civil War, and was known as the "Danville System". Large tobacco firms sent representatives to purchase tobacco from farmers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Warehouses; Tobacco; Commerce
